I’m full of holes but still hold water. What am I?
The more you take away, the larger I become. What am I?
I’m not alive, but I grow. I don’t have lungs, but I need air. What am I?
I’m always hungry. I must be fed. The finger I touch will soon turn red. What am I?
I’m a path that twists and turns but never moves. What am I?
I’m a word of letters three, add two and fewer there will be. What am I?
I have a heart that doesn’t beat. I sail oceans without getting wet. What am I?
I’m swallowed whole but never eaten. I’m kept safe until needed. What am I?
I’m opened before I’m used and closed after I’m used. What am I?
I’m a weight you can’t lift. I’m a guest who never leaves. What am I?
I’m a box that holds no food, yet feeds many minds. What am I?
I’m a word that’s spelled wrong in every dictionary. What am I?
I’m a child of water, but when water returns, I die. What am I?
I’m a hole you can fill but never dig. What am I?
I’m a king’s accessory, a prisoner’s view. I frame the world for you. What am I?
I’m a beginning of eternity and the end of time. What am I?
I’m a cup that grows in earth and wears a leafy crown. What am I?
I’m a barrier that unites. I’m torn down to cheers. What am I?
I’m a weightless treasure chest. Open me with your mind. What am I?
I’m a season with no sun, yet I bring light. What am I?
I’m a lock with no key. I’m a rhythm with no beat. What am I?
I’m a gift you can’t wrap. I’m kept by giving away. What am I?
I’m a bridge you burn after crossing. What am I?
I’m a servant who serves a thousand. Abandoned by one, I’m useless. What am I?
I’m a book with no pages. I’m a voice with no sound. What am I?
I’m a cage that frees you. I’m opened to capture. What am I?
I have forests without trees, cities without people, and deserts without sand. What am I?
I’m a seed with cities in me, yet I fit in your palm. Plant me and nothing grows. What am I?
I’m a cage without bars, a trap without bait. I catch thoughts but never wait. What am I?
I’m a tongue without a mouth, answered without a sound. I’m feared by every liar. What am I?
I’m a giant who dwarfs mountains yet hides in acorns. What am I?
I’m a box of thunder with no lightning. Open me to find silence. What am I?
I’m a thief who steals warmth but leaves no trace. What am I?
I’m a ladder you can’t climb, with rungs made of light. What am I?
I’m a servant who obeys all, yet rules none. Point me, and I work. What am I?
I’m the end of a rainbow, the start of a joke, and forever in debt. What am I?
